description: Explore the hidden corners of Queen Mary University's Mile End campus. Guided tour includes the former People’s Palace (1887), Mile End Hospital (1858), and the Sephardic Jewish cemetery (1733), the UK’s second oldest Jewish cemetery.

events.name: Queen Mary's Victorian History
events.notes: The tour will include exteriors and interiors of the former People’s Palace (1887), the Mile End Hospital (1858), and the Sephardic Jewish cemetery (1733), the second oldest Jewish cemetery in the country and how these places figured in the lives of those who lived, worked, played and died in Victorian Mile End.

events.notes: The tour will include exteriors and interiors of the former People’s Palace (1887), the Mile End Hospital (1858), and the Sephardic Jewish cemetery (1733), the second oldest Jewish cemetery in the country and how these places figured in the lives of those who lived, worked, played and died in Victorian Mile End.

events.notes: The tour will include exteriors and interiors of the former People’s Palace (1887), the Mile End Hospital (1858), and the Sephardic Jewish cemetery (1733), the second oldest Jewish cemetery in the country and how these places figured in the lives of those who lived, worked, played and died in Victorian Mile End.

factsheet.heading: Tour Overview
paragraphs: Queen Mary University’s Mile End campus has evolved around pre-existing religious, welfare and educational buildings and institutions. This tour around the campus offers glimpses into the area’s eighteenth and nineteenth-century social history, in particular the lives of migrants, the working poor and the destitute, via these surviving fragments.

Tour includes: 
Queens Building (formerly the People’s Palace, (E.R. Robson, 1887), 
Octagon (formerly the People’s Palace Library (E.R. Robson, 1888)
Mile End Hospital (formerly parish workhouse, William Dobson, 1858), 
Novo Cemetery (1733, extended 1855).

location.address: Queens' Building, Mile End Road, E1 4NS
travel_info: Nearest tube: Whitechapel, Mile End, Stepney Green, Bethnal Green, Limehouse

name: Queen Mary  University of London, Mile End Campus
